intro: Dalechampia albibracteosa, commonly known as the white bract dalechampia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with unique floral structures. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. Its most distinctive feature is the presence of white bracts that surround the inflorescence, giving it its common name. It thrives in moist, wooded areas and is often found in swampy or wetland habitats.
